intro: Nauclea moluccana, commonly known as the Moluccan nauclea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, aiding in its dispersal. Nauclea moluccana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
